intro: Lampranthus inconspicuus, commonly known as the dwarf ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Lampranthus inconspicuus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and striking floral display.
